data.title: Genealogy.com
data.meta_description: Family Tree Maker user home page for Larry-A-Maxwell.
data.text:
Notes for Lieut. Samuel Marvin:

Samuel Marvin served as a Norwalk Townsman in 1702, 1707, 1710, 1712, 1714, 1724 and 1727.He served as Lyster in 1716 and 1723 and as Surveyor in 1719 and 1721.He was a Representative for Norwalk in 1708 and 1718. In 1712, he was an Ensign in the Train Band.On 19 October 1719, he was confirmed by the Legislature as Lieutenant of the South Company.

From February 1732, until his death, he lived in Wilton.His previous home in Norwalk was one of the oldest homes still standing in 1902.

Notes for Joseph Platt I:

In 1698 he received a grant of land from the Town of Norwalk, CT., for services as a solider in the war.He served as a Deputy from Norwalk to the Connecticut Assembly.He was Captain of the North Company in Norwalk, CT. in May 1710.
